forumNotes.author: Sha0
forumNotes.content:
Let's call the problem computer's internal HDD "bad HDD." If you attach the "bad HDD" to some other computer using an IDE-to-USB adapter, then you can further "attach" that "bad HDD" to a virtual machine... And install FreeBSD on it from inside the virtual machine. Would that work for you?  

Another option might be installing the Plop boot manager on the "bad HDD" so that it can be put back inside the problem computer and hopefully boot your USB devices afterwards.
